description: The World Wide Web hosts some millions of terabytes of data that is impossible to search if you use a directory-based search. Search Engines evolved into more than just semantics. Pulling up relevant results in a few milliseconds requires more than Crawling, Understanding about us. This major deals with the technologies/various methods used in finding relevant information on the web. The objective of this major is to understand the existing techniques of search engines and use mathematical models to build a fair search engine.
key_major_takeaways: Given a set of documents, find the term frequency & document frequency
Create an inverted index for a set of documents
Design and implement a secondary index for a set of documents
